unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Probability of Winning a Basketball Game
question_text:
A basketball team plays $60\%$ of its games at home.
The home-court advantage is obvious because the team wins $70\%$ of all its home games and only $35\%$ of their away games. Suppose the team plays one game.
What is the probability that they won the game?
solution:
The easiest way to visualize this problem is with a tree diagram.

The probability of each of the four possible paths is obtained by multiplying the two probabilities along each path.

Either of two paths results in a win:

Play at home and win, with $P = 0.6 \cdot 0.7 = 0.42$

Play away and win, with P=0.4â‹…0.35=0.14

Add these disjoint probabilities together to result in the overall probability of winning a game:

(0.42+0.14)=0.56

Therefore, the basketball team has a 56% chance, or 0.56 probability, of winning the game, so Choice 'D' is correct.
